data.text:
Avraham Ohayon Sings For Toulouse Victims

Avraham Ohayon presents a new song Aheinu to benefit the family's of Toulouse tragedy, that occurred early morning on Monday, March 19th 2012, one Rabbi and three Jewish children were murdered in front of a Jewish school in Toulouse, France for the only reason that they were Jewish,

Cantor Helfgot Sings at KMR Summer 2011

The Werner Brothers of KMR present "Esa Einai El Heharim" in the Candaian Rocky Montains. Featuring cantor Yitzchok Meir Helfgott, accompanied by pianist cantor Daniel Gildar at The 5 Diamond Fairmont Lake Louise, in Alberta, Canada. Summer 2011.

To join KMR at this year's retreat in either the Canadian Rockies at the Fairmont Banff Springs (July 1 - July 12, 2012) or in the Colorado Rockies at the Vail Cascade (August 6 - August 19, 2012), visit their Website www.kmrtours.com or call their office at 1888 567-0100.

Russian President Putin Visits The Kotel

Russian President Vladimir Putin visited the Western Wall overnight Tuesday. Putin arrived in Jerusalem's Old City at 1:30 am Tuesday, and made his third visit to the Western Wall, a yarmulke on his head, commenting on the deep Jewish connection to the holy site, During the course of his visit, Putin spoke with other visitors at the site, asked many questions, and according to Yedioth Ahronoth, chatted at length with an ultra-Orthodox immigrant from the former Soviet Union.

Documentary On Williamsburg

From the Uploader: A New York University Special Topics Summer 2012 - "Neighborhoods" project documenting a part of New York City. We documented the contrast between the hasidic community and the "hipster" culture that has sprung up on the norther side of the Williamsburg bridge.

Mama Bear To The Rescue

A California homeowner went into the garage and made a surprising discovery. A baby bear was trapped inside, balancing on a bar over the car. The cub struggled to hold on to the track connected to the garage door as the mother bear tried to come to the rescue. The mama bear was able to open the door as the cub dangled from the bar. The cub was able to reach the ladder, climb down and run after the mom.

Rally for Egypt's Newly Elected President Morsi

Mohammed Morsi was declared Egypt’s first Islamist president on Sunday after the freest elections in the country’s history, narrowly defeating Hosni Mubarak’s last Prime Minister Ahmed Shafiq in a race that raised political tensions in Egypt to a fever pitch. The country’s last four presidents over the past six decades have all came from the ranks of the military. This is the first time modern Egypt will be headed by an Islamist and by a freely elected civilian

Watch Israel’s new neighbor at a rally last month, for the then Egyptian Presidential candidate Mohammed Morsi. On May 1, 2012, Egyptian Cleric Safwat Higazi Launches Candidate Muhammad Mursi's Campaign: Mursi Will Restore the "United States of the Arabs" with Jerusalem as Its Capital. Al-Nas TV (Egypt).

5000 Ducks Go For A Walk

In China, 5000 ducks stopped traffic during a walk to their feeding pond. The ducks march in orderly lines through the Chinese city of Taizhou, and Hong Minghsu has about 10,000 ducks on the farm. Hong performs this duck march a few times each year.

MBD Sings For Dovid Hill A"H

Mordechai Ben David sings Ad Mosai at the hospital bed of a fourteen year old Israeli boy Dovid Hill A"H. Dovid Hill passed away Friday afternoon June 25, 2012, at Memorial Sloan Kettering Hospital in Manhattan after a five year battle with cancer. Dovid and his parents had come from Jerusalem several times over the past few years and, most recently, the entire Hill family was relocated to New York to help facilitate treatments with the help of Chai Lifeline, who assisted in sponsoring the cost of airfare.

Dovid’s face and his melodious voice became familiar to many this past winter after several Video clips captured him singing songs at the Bein Ish U’Bein Achiv Melava Malkah- an organization to countless seriously ill patients and their families - this past January, one of which was his original composition. Click Here for more info

Volcano Garbage Incinerator

That's what happens if a box of garbage falls into a volcano lake, The test was performed with a box of camp waste largely food rests in a bin bag. Estimated weight 65 lbs, Fall height, about 262 feet, The lake reacts with violent lava fountaining activity, presumably in part due to steam produced from the organic matter.

Thousands Rally Against Drafting Yeshiva Students

Thousands of Charedim took to the streets of Kikar Hashabaos in Jerusalem early this Monday morning to protest against a military draft of Yeshiva students. The protesters at the rally wore sackcloth and ashes blew the (Shofar) trumpets and read psalms to cancel the decree. Among the rabbis who attended the event: Toldos Aharon Rebbe, The rabbi of Eidah HaCaredit Rabbi Tuvia Weiss , Rabbi Shmuel Auerbach , Rabbi Shmuel Sternbuch, Rabbi Moshe Tzdokah.

Abie Rotenberg at Chai Lifeline Niagara Trip for Teens

Abie Rotenberg sings for the teens of Chai Lifeline on Motzei Shabbos, June 16th.

A group of teenage boys battling cancer, from across North America, partied on a six day trip to Niagara Falls, NY, & Toronto, Canada. This was the fourth annual Journeys Trip for teens with cancer. Previous destinations include Washington, D.C. & Virginia. Many thanks to Abie, all the musicians, and the Shiff family for hosting.

Dog And His Tiger Cub Friends

Meet Solo the dog who has struck up an unlikely friendship with a TIGER. The tricolour Border Collie and the eight-month old tiger cub are inseparable - sleeping, eating and playing together. The new buddies even share meals from the same bowl and groom one another. Game keeper Ashley Gombert, from Port Elizabeth, South Africa, first noticed his trusty dog was friendly with the ferocious cat when he spotted them splashing around in a lake.

Brave 11 Year-Old Calls 911

A brave 11-year-old boy from Hollywood, Fla., helped police arrest three suspects who broke into his home Thursday evening while he hid under his bed. The boy, Luis Gutierrez Jr., was home alone when he heard glass shattering and voices in the house. Fearful, he hid under his bed and called 911 for help.
